info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:52PM EST until January 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... South Fork Catawba River At Lowell affecting Gaston County. .A potent storm system produced 2.5-4.5 inches of rainfall across the South Fork Catawba watershed from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. This rainfall quickly overwhelmed saturated soils and resulted in excessive runoff and significant stream rises across southeastern Burke County, Catawba County, Lincoln County, and Gaston County, with several small tributaries of the SF Catawba River exceeding bankfull and causing Minor to Moderate flooding of adjacent areas. This excessive flow has caused the SF Catawba River near Lowell, McAdenville, and Cramerton to exceed Moderate Flood Stage, resulting in significant lowland inundation with floodwaters approaching vulnerable buildings and property near Cramerton. Tributaries feeding the SF Catawba River have been stubbornly rising through the early nighttime hours in response to impressive soil saturation and runoff. This has prolonged the rise downstream along the SF Catawba River from Lowell to Cramerton, resulting in an increase in the expected crest from 13.6 feet to near 14.2 feet. However, most tributaries are finally cresting and receding. Therefore, the floodwave is approaching the lower reaches of the SF Catawba River and a crest is imminent, expected between midnight and 2am tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Catawba River at Lowell. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate Flooding continues. The South Fork Catawba may be flooding several roads in the Cramerton area, including Cramer Mountain Rd along Duharts Creek, Riverside Dr, 8th Ave near the South Fork Masonic Lodge and adjacent park, and Greenwood Pl near Lakewood Park. Significant inundation is overwhemling Goat Island and Riverside parks. Flooding at the Cramerton Fire Department, Cramerton Drug Company, and the South Fork Masonic Lodge may be ongoing or imminent. The South Fork Catawba River may be entering the crawl spaces of homes along Riverside Dr between 4th St and 5th St in Cramerton. Floodwaters may be approaching Lakeview Dr in McAdenville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.7 feet and rising steadily. - Action/Advisory Stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of between 14.1 and 14.4 feet between midnight and 2am tonight. It will then fall below Moderate Flood Stage later this morning and below Minor Flood Stage early Thursday morning. - Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. Moderate Flood Stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued beforeWednesday afternoon at noon EST.
